mechanoreception.notes: Rotifers generally possess sensory bristles and cilia for detecting water currents and tactile stimuli. Inferred to be present for prey capture and predator avoidance.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is vital for locating food and mates in aquatic environments. Likely mediated by receptors on the corona and body surface.

vision.notes: The presence or absence of eyespots or other visual structures in Lecanidae is not mentioned in the provided context.
